critique: The document focuses on the delegation of authority for conducting a census related to employment and unemployment. It outlines the powers and responsibilities of the Administrator, including the ability to appoint personnel and make necessary expenditures. There is a slight tilt towards expanding executive power due to the broad delegation of authority to the Administrator. Economic regulation is moderately present as the census aims to understand and address employment issues. Federalism is strong as it centralizes the census at the federal level. The other axes are neutral.
